moves.3... fxe5: Theory says that 3... Qe7 avoids any material loss after 4. Nf3 Qxe4+ 5. Be2, but with a totally bad position. After this move, White already has a winning position.
moves.4. Qh5+ Ke7: The lesser evil was 4... g6 5. Qxe5+ followed by Qxh8.
moves.5. Qxe5+ Kf7 6. Bc4+ Kg6: 6... d5 is much better, controlling the square f5 and making the attack much harder.
moves.7. Qf5+ Kh6 8. d4+ g5 9. h4: The key of the attack, now the Rook might join too.
moves.9... d5 10. Qf7: Controlling the g7 square, and creating many mating threats.
